segments.text: I see the large cookie jar, its label practically glowing with the promise of sweets.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The moment feels classic, like a scene from a nostalgic childhood memory.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I chuckle a little inside at how every kid instinctively knows where the cookies are stored.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But then I glance at the water spreading across the floor, and my smile fades.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What a contradiction; the laughter of children in a space thatâ€™s slowly becoming a hazard.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That dish towel gripped tightly, fumbling to keep just one plate dry while everything else falls apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will notice the crunch of cookies underfoot if disaster strikes.
segments.speaker: PAR
